result.execSummary:
The defendant John A Valdez was found guilty of the following charge(s) in this case.

  • Disorderly Conduct [Modifiers: Domestic Abuse], a class B misdemeanor, Wisconsin Statutes 947.01(1).

Notice to employers: It may be a violation of state law to discriminate against a job applicant because of an arrest or conviction record. Generally speaking, an employer may refuse to hire an applicant on the basis of a conviction only if the circumstances of the conviction substantially relate to the particular job. For more information, see Wisconsin Statute 111.335 and the Department of Workforce Development's publication, Arrest and Conviction Records under the Law.

miscConds.notes: $100 fine plus costs.   Cash bond applied. If probation is revoked or discharged with outstanding financial obligations, a civil judgment shall be entered against the defendant in favor of restitution victims and/or governmental entities for the balance due.  All available enforcement actions will be used to collect the debt. To pay supervision fees as ordered by the Dept. of Corrections.

Maintain absolute sobriety from alcohol. No violent contact with his wife and son.   Not to possess or consume any controlled substances without a valid prescription and then only take in the amount and frequency prescribed.

Complete any counseling, evaluations, programs and assessments, including AODA assessment, as appropriate resulting from the Department's COMPAS assessment.  Must write a minimum 250 word apology letter to both victims (one letter for both). This to be done within the first 30 days of probation.  Defendant can petition for early termination of probation after 6 months upon successful completion of all conditions of probation and with recommendation from Dept. of Corrections.  Defendant must have a DNA sample on file with the State of Wisconsin and pay the DNA surcharge.

timeConds.notes: Stayed - to be used at the Court's discretion by petition from probation agent. If stay is lifted, huber release is granted.

result.caption: State of Wisconsin vs. John A Valdez

records.descr: Records of prosec. are converted data. See file.

records.addlTxt:
ADDRESS INFO for John A Valdez
Current: 178 West Park,  Apt. 115, Forestville, WI 54213 United States  (Effective: 09-14-2015)
Prior: 715 W. Maple Street, Sturgeon Bay, WI 54235 United States

Defendant John A Valdez in court.  Joan M. Korb appeared for the State of Wisconsin.  Minute sheet. State gives plea agreement.  Court questions defendant on change of plea.  Rights/elements/max. penalties reviewed with defendant.  Defendant enters guilty plea.  Defendant stipulates to factual basis to accept plea.  Court finds plea made freely, knowingly and voluntarily, accepts plea, and finds guilty. Atty Korb makes sentencing statement. Court makes statement, imposes sentence. Bond is no longer in effect.

(per phone call from Defendant)
ADDRESS INFO for John A Valdez
Current: 715 W. Maple Street, Sturgeon Bay, WI 54235 United States  (Effective: 07-14-2015)
Prior: 8519 County Rd J, Forestville, WI 54213 United States
Court lifts no contact with B.V.  Defendant to have no violent contact with B.V.   Maintain absolute sobriety from alcohol.

No contact modification request from victim asking court to lift the no contact between defendant and herself. State has no objection. Court amends bond to no violent contact. All other conditions of bond remain the same.

ADDRESS INFO for John A Valdez
Current: 8519 County Rd J, Forestville, WI 54213 United States  (Effective: 07-01-2015)
Prior: 715 W Maple St, Sturgeon Bay, WI 54235
No contact direct or indirect with B.V. except he can stop at the house on his way back to work to pick up his boots.   Maintain absolute sobriety from alcohol.

Defendant John A Valdez in court.  Joan M. Korb appeared for the State of Wisconsin.  Copy of Complaint given to Defendant in Court.  Court reviews charge(s), max. penalties, right to counsel.  Defendant wants to try to resolve matter with DA, waives right to Counsel.  Court questions Defendant, finds defendant competent to proceed, finds waiver made freely and voluntarily, accepts waiver.  Defendant to make appointment with DA.  Bond set.  Status conference scheduled for July 24, 2015 at 03:15 pm.
Defendant was fingerprinted 5/27/15 by jail staff. (fingerprint card destroyed 7/28/15)
